headline: Micron (MU) Expands Manufacturing Footprint as AI Drives Long-Term Memory Demand
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is among Goldman Sachs’ top semiconductor stock picks. On January 27, Micron Technology, Inc. headline: Micron’s US$24b Singapore Bet On AI NAND Raises Valuation Questions
summary: Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) plans to invest $24b in a new advanced wafer fabrication facility in Singapore. The project expands global NAND memory capacity to support AI and data driven applications. The facility is expected to include advanced robotics and sustainability features and create thousands of jobs in Singapore. Micron Technology, known for its memory and storage products, is tying this $24b Singapore build out directly to demand linked to AI and data heavy workloads. NAND is...

headline: Robinhood to Vie for Key Retail Role in Mega SpaceX IPO
summary: Robinhood is jockeying with several Wall Street banks to secure a big slug of coveted SpaceX stock to sell directly to its retail investors, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the details aren’t public.  The company would likely offer the shares through its IPO Access platform, which lets users buy stock at the IPO price, before they trade on the open market.  Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite company is considering earmarking a significant portion of the shares for retail investors, the people said.

content.title: Robinhood to Vie for Key Retail Role in Mega SpaceX IPO
content.summary: Robinhood is jockeying with several Wall Street banks to secure a big slug of coveted SpaceX stock to sell directly to its retail investors, said the people, who asked to not be identified because the details aren’t public.  The company would likely offer the shares through its IPO Access platform, which lets users buy stock at the IPO price, before they trade on the open market.  Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite company is considering earmarking a significant portion of the shares for retail investors, the people said.

headline: Micron Stock Pops. Samsung Signals ‘Golden Era’ for Memory Chips.
summary: Micron Technology  stock was rising early Thursday.  Its peer  Samsung Electronics  is confident the memory-chip boom will continue for the foreseeable future.  More importantly for Micron, its executives expect demand to outstrip supply across the memory-chip sector, driven by the need to power artificial intelligence.

content.title: Micron Stock Pops. Samsung Signals ‘Golden Era’ for Memory Chips.

More importantly for Micron, its executives expect demand to outstrip supply across the memory-chip sector, driven by the need to power artificial intelligence.

headline: A Tiny $1 Billion Semiconductor ETF Bet Everything on 30 Memory and Equipment Stocks, And Wow
summary: The Invesco Semiconductors ETF (NYSEARCA:PSI) has captured the AI infrastructure boom with a 45% surge over the past year. This rally reflects the fund’s concentrated strategy of placing focused bets on equipment manufacturers and memory chips rather than diversifying across all chip types. That specialization creates both opportunity and risk. The fund’s nearly $1 billion ... A Tiny $1 Billion Semiconductor ETF Bet Everything on 30 Memory and Equipment Stocks, And Wow

headline: Analysis-Is chip giant ASML about to hit a ceiling, or break through it?
summary: ASML's latest results reignited the rally that has made it Europe's most valuable company, until questions about its capacity to meet record orders sent the stock sliding - highlighting just how stretched ​expectations have become.  The whipsaw trading underscores how the firm, whose tools are used by chipmakers such as Taiwan's TSMC to produce AI chips for Nvidia, is testing the ‌limits of investor appetite.  ASML shares are up 34% so far this month and trade at 42 times 2026 earnings estimates, well above Nvidia's 25 times, as analysts have ratcheted up forecasts.

content.title: Analysis-Is chip giant ASML about to hit a ceiling, or break through it?
content.summary: ASML's latest results reignited the rally that has made it Europe's most valuable company, until questions about its capacity to meet record orders sent the stock sliding - highlighting just how stretched ​expectations have become.  The whipsaw trading underscores how the firm, whose tools are used by chipmakers such as Taiwan's TSMC to produce AI chips for Nvidia, is testing the ‌limits of investor appetite.  ASML shares are up 34% so far this month and trade at 42 times 2026 earnings estimates, well above Nvidia's 25 times, as analysts have ratcheted up forecasts.
